tn.text: To become higher describes becoming more powerful. AT: "An enemy of Israel became more powerful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
To have caused someone to act.
The Israelites considered these two cities their most southern and most northern cities. David uses these cities to refer to all of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: a hundred times greater than it is
tn.text: Joab expresses the desire for an army the size of 100 armies to say he would like the army to have more soldiers and be more powerful. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: But my master the king, do they not all serve my master? Why does my master want this? Why bring guilt on Israel?
tn.text: AT: But my master the king, they all serve you already. My master should not request this. You will only bring guilt on the people of Israel by your desire for military power." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: Why does my master want this?
tn.text: The word "this" refers to David's plan to count all the men of Israel.

This phrase refers to king David's order to be final because he would not change his order after it was given. AT: "the king's order was not going to change" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The soldiers in Israel are described by the action of pulling out a sword to fight with. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: But Levi and Benjamin were not counted among them
tn.text: AT: "But Joab did not count the men from the tribes of Levi and Benjamin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"this action" refers to David's plan to count all the men of Israel who are able to fight.
Forgiveness is described as having guilt taken away. AT: "forgive me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
David refers to himself as God's servant. AT: "my guilt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
This phrase is a mild way to describe being killed by the enemy. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
This phrase describes Yahweh's method of killing by the tool a soldier would use to kill. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "killing"
AT: "I am in a great amount of trouble" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Let me fall into the hand of Yahweh rather than into the hand of man, for his merciful actions are very great
tn.text: AT: "Let me come under the control of Yahweh, rather than under the control of people, for Yahweh is very merciful." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"and 70,000 people died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
To change a decision. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Yahweh tells the destroying angel to stop killing the people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: the angel of Yahweh was standing
tn.text: The angel of Yahweh is described as something that would stand as a person would stand. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: having a drawn sword in his hand
tn.text: AT: "ready to attack" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Is it not I that commanded that the army be numbered?
tn.text: AT: "I am the one who commanded that the army be numbered." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
David describes the people of Israel as a type of animal that will trust and follow a leader. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
AT: "They certainly have done nothing that deserves punishment." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: as Gad instructed him to do in the name of Yahweh
tn.text: AT: "as Gad, speaking with Yahweh's authority, had told David to do."

tn.ref: with his face to the ground
tn.text: This phrase describes that Ornan bowed far forward. To bow before someone is a way to show humility and respect. A deeper bow shows greater humility and respect.
